ca.uwaterloo.epad.ui

Class MoveableItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.PGraphicsDelegate
      • vialab.SMT.Zone
        • ca.uwaterloo.epad.ui.MoveableItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener, processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Brush, Paint

    public class MoveableItem
extends vialab.SMT.Zone
    This class implements the default functionality of all widgets used in ePad application, such as the default drawing method, ability to be placed into and dragged out of the drawers and default multitouch interactions (move, scale and rotate).
    Important: every new widget must extend this class to take the advantage of this default functionality and also to be handled properly by SimpleMarshaller class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveableItem

        public MoveableItem(int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the top right corner of the item
        y - y-coordinate of the top right corner of the item
        width - width of the item
        height - height of the item

      • MoveableItem

        public MoveableItem(MoveableItem original)
        Constructor that builds a copy of another MoveableItem object. It is important that the subclasses of MoveableItem class override this constructor since it is used in SimpleMarshaller class.
        Parameters:
        original - the original MoveableItem object.

    • Method Detail

      • doInit

        public void doInit()
        Override this function in a subclass to perform an initialisation step.

      • setDrawer

        public void setDrawer(int drawerId,
             boolean isInDrawer)
        Set the item's parent drawer.
        Parameters:
        drawerId - must be one of the following: Application.TOP_DRAWER, Application.LEFT_DRAWER or Application.RIGHT_DRAWER; the item will be added to the appropriate drawer, if it exists in the GUI.
        isInDrawer - set to true if you would like to put the item into the drawer and to false if the item will be added directly to the screen.

      • addToScreen

        public void addToScreen()
        Add the item to the screen.

      • select

        public void select()
        Mark the item as selected (it will be drawn with a highlight).
        See Also:
        deselect()

      • deselect

        public void deselect()
        Mark the item as not selected.
        See Also:
        select()

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected()
        Returns:
        true if the item is marked as selected and false otherwise
        See Also:
        select(), deselect()

                   int secondary)
        Set the colour scheme of the item.
        Parameters:
        primary - primary colour
        secondary - secondary colour

      • getImage

        public java.lang.String getImage()
        Returns:
        the path to the item's image.

      • getDrawerId

        public int getDrawerId()
        Returns:
        ID of the item's parent drawer, it must be one of the following: Application.TOP_DRAWER, Application.LEFT_DRAWER or Application.RIGHT_DRAWER

      • getIsDragged

        public boolean getIsDragged()
        Returns:
        true if the item is currently being moved around and false otherwise
